document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Tachytes Panzer (Hymenoptera: Crabronidae: Crabroninae) of South Korea, with description of one new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Tachytes Panzer (Hymenoptera: Crabronidae: Crabroninae) of South Korea, with description of one new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Female. Body length 11.0– 13.3 mm . LID subequal or slightly longer than flagellomere I (
Fig. 2
E). Inner eye margins comparatively less divergent below, MID ca. 3.5 or a little × as long as LID (
Fig. 2
E). Clypeus with apical margin broadly round, without notch and protuberance (
Fig. 2
E). Pygidial plate an equilateral triangle in shape, and its apical margin broadly round. Body almost entirely black, except for ferruginous palpi, tegula, and spurs and spines of all legs.

Male. Body length 9.0– 11.3 mm . LID ca. 1.3 × as long as flagellomere I (
Fig. 2
F). MID ca. 3.0 × as long as LID (
Fig. 2
F). Bristles on pygidial plate golden. Distal part of lateral margins of sternum VIII weakly convergent; apicolateral teeth somewhat acute. Genitalia as in
Fig. 4
F: lateral margins of aedeagus parallel; gonocoxite slender, rod-shape with proximal part slightly and broadly convex.

Specimens examined. [ South Korea ] 4 ♀ , Daegok-ri, Haemi-myeon, Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do,
